snippet.title: Achieving Climate Ambitions: How Your Professional Body Can Help // Environmental Policy Forum (EPF)
snippet.description:
This three-part event series, taking place immediately after the conclusion of the 26th UN Climate Change Conference (COP26), explores the ‘what next?’ question; how we, as professionals and organisations, can ensure that climate commitments decided at COP26 can be realised via tangible, science-based action and policy change. 

Organised by the Environmental Policy Forum (EPF), a collective of professional bodies working in collaboration, the series brings together organisations and professional bodies from across sectors to reflect, discuss and engage. 

- - -

Achieving Your Climate Ambitions: How Your Professional Body Can Help 

Watch this recording to find out about the kind of support available from your professional body, including reaching net zero, CPD opportunities, routes to professional registration, lending your voice to policy work & more. 

Taking part was: 

Ian Bowbrick CEnv, Director of Membership and Professional Standards, Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining (IOM3)

Amber Connett, Policy Officer, Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management (CIEEM)

Ben Goodwin, Head of Policy, Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment (IEMA)

Ben Brown, Head of Policy and Insight, Landscape Institute
